info.name: Velt REST API v2
info.description:
# üöÄ Velt REST API v2

This collection contains all Velt REST API v2 endpoints for managing organizations, documents, folders, users, comments, notifications, and more.

## üîê Authentication

All requests require two headers:
- `x-velt-api-key`: Your API key from the Velt Console
- `x-velt-auth-token`: Your Auth Token

## üìù Getting Started

1. **Set up variables**: Click on the collection and go to the Variables tab
   - Set `api_key` to your Velt API key
   - Set `auth_token` to your Velt Auth Token
   - Base URL is already set to `https://api.velt.dev`

2. **Choose an endpoint**: Navigate through the folders to find the endpoint you need

3. **Update request body**: Replace placeholder values (like `yourOrganizationId`) with your actual data

4. **Send request**: Click Send to execute the request

## üìö Documentation

Full documentation: https://docs.velt.dev/api-reference/rest-apis/v2

## üîó Base URL

`https://api.velt.dev/v2`

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Important Notes

- Most endpoints use POST method
- All request/response bodies are in JSON format
- Responses include either a `result` object (success) or `error` object (failure)
- Some endpoints require advanced queries to be enabled in the Velt Console

item.name: Organizations
item.description:
Organizations are the top-level containers in Velt. All documents, folders, and users belong to an organization.

**Available Operations:**
- Add: Create new organizations
- Get: Retrieve organization details
- Update: Modify organization metadata
- Delete: Remove organizations
- Update Disabled State: Enable/disable organizations

request.description:
Use this API to add new organizations and its metadata.

**Key Points:**
- Organizations serve as the top-level container for all your documents and users
- If an organization already exists, this will update its metadata
- Organization ID must be unique within your workspace

**Response:**
Returns a success status with the organization ID upon successful creation.

üìö Full Documentation: https://docs.velt.dev/api-reference/rest-apis/v2/organizations/add-organizations

Use this API to retrieve specific organizations by organization IDs.

**Key Points:**
- Retrieve up to 30 organization IDs at a time
- Supports pagination with pageToken
- If no organizationIds provided, returns all organizations

**Requirements:**
- Enable advanced queries in the Velt Console
- Deploy v4 series of the Velt SDK

üìö Full Documentation: https://docs.velt.dev/api-reference/rest-apis/v2/organizations/get-organizations-v2

Use this API to update existing organization(s) metadata.

**Key Points:**
- Update organization name and other metadata fields
- Organization must already exist
- Can update multiple organizations in a single request

üìö Full Documentation: https://docs.velt.dev/api-reference/rest-apis/v2/organizations/update-organizations

Use this API to delete specific organization(s) data by their IDs.

**Warning:**
This will permanently delete all data associated with the organization including documents, folders, and user access.

**Key Points:**
- Can delete multiple organizations in one request
- Returns individual status for each organization

üìö Full Documentation: https://docs.velt.dev/api-reference/rest-apis/v2/organizations/delete-organizations

Use this API to enable or disable organizations without deleting them.

**Key Points:**
- Disabled organizations prevent all user access while preserving data
- Set `disabled` to `true` to disable, `false` to enable
- Useful for temporary suspension of organizations

üìö Full Documentation: https://docs.velt.dev/api-reference/rest-apis/v2/organizations/update-organization-disable-state

item.name: Folders
item.description:
Folders help organize documents within an organization. You can create nested folder structures and manage access control at the folder level.

**Available Operations:**
- Add: Create new folders
- Get: Retrieve folder details
- Update: Modify folder metadata
- Delete: Remove folders
- Update Access: Control folder access permissions

request.description:
Use this API to create a new folder in an organization.

**Key Points:**
- Folders help organize documents within an organization
- Can create nested folders using parentFolderId
- If organization doesn't exist, set createOrganization flag

**Requirements:**
- Enable advanced queries in the Velt Console
- Deploy v4 series of the Velt SDK

üìö Full Documentation: https://docs.velt.dev/api-reference/rest-apis/v2/folders/add-folder

Generated from cURL: curl --location --request POST 'https://api.velt.dev/v2/organizations/folders/get' --header 'x-velt-api-key: <your-api-key>' --header 'x-velt-auth-token: <your-auth-token>' --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-raw '{"data":{"organizationId":"yourOrganizationId"}}'

Generated from cURL: curl --location --request POST 'https://api.velt.dev/v2/organizations/folders/update' --header 'x-velt-api-key: <your-api-key>' --header 'x-velt-auth-token: <your-auth-token>' --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-raw '{"data":{"organizationId":"yourOrganizationId","folders":[{"folderId":"yourFolderId","folderName":"yourFolderName","parentFolderId":"yourParentFolderId"}]}}'

Generated from cURL: curl --location --request POST 'https://api.velt.dev/v2/organizations/folders/access/update' --header 'x-velt-api-key: <your-api-key>' --header 'x-velt-auth-token: <your-auth-token>' --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-raw '{"data":{"organizationId":"yourOrganizationId","folderIds":["yourFolderId1","yourFolderId2"],"accessType":"organizationPrivate"}}'

item.name: Documents
item.description:
Documents represent individual pages or files in your application where collaboration features are enabled.

**Available Operations:**
- Add: Create new documents
- Get: Retrieve document details
- Update: Modify document metadata
- Delete: Remove documents
- Move: Move documents between folders
- Update Access: Control document access
- Update Disabled State: Enable/disable documents

request.description: Generated from cURL: curl --location --request POST 'https://api.velt.dev/v2/organizations/documents/get' --header 'x-velt-api-key: <your-api-key>' --header 'x-velt-auth-token: <your-auth-token>' --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-raw '{"data": {"organizationId": "yourOrganizationId"}}'

Generated from cURL: curl --location --request POST 'https://api.velt.dev/v2/organizations/documents/update' --header 'x-velt-api-key: <your-api-key>' --header 'x-velt-auth-token: <your-auth-token>' --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-raw '{"data": {"organizationId": "yourOrganizationId","documents": [{"documentId": "yourDocumentId","documentName": "Your Document Name"}]}}'

Generated from cURL: curl --location --request POST 'https://api.velt.dev/v2/organizations/documents/delete' --header 'x-velt-api-key: <your-api-key>' --header 'x-velt-auth-token: <your-auth-token>' --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-raw '{"data": {"organizationId": "yourOrganizationId","documentIds": ["yourDocumentId1", "yourDocumentId2"]}}'

Generated from cURL: curl --location --request POST 'https://api.velt.dev/v2/organizations/documents/move' --header 'x-velt-api-key: <your-api-key>' --header 'x-velt-auth-token: <your-auth-token>' --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-raw '{"data": {"organizationId": "yourOrganizationId","documentIds": ["yourDocumentId1", "yourDocumentId2"],"folderId": "targetFolderId"}}'

Generated from cURL: curl --location --request POST 'https://api.velt.dev/v2/organizations/documents/access/update' --header 'x-velt-api-key: <your-api-key>' --header 'x-velt-auth-token: <your-auth-token>' --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-raw '{"data": {"organizationId": "yourOrganizationId","documentIds": ["yourDocumentId1", "yourDocumentId2"],"accessType": "organizationPrivate"}}'

Generated from cURL: curl --location --request POST 'https://api.velt.dev/v2/organizations/documents/access/disablestate/update' --header 'x-velt-api-key: <your-api-key>' --header 'x-velt-auth-token: <your-auth-token>' --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-raw '{"data": {"organizationId": "yourOrganizationId","documentIds": ["yourDocumentId"],"disabled": true}}'

item.name: Users
item.description:
Manage users and their access to organizations, folders, and documents. Users can be assigned different access roles (viewer or editor).

**Available Operations:**
- Add: Add users to organization/folder/document
- Get: Retrieve user information
- Update: Modify user details and access roles
- Delete: Remove users

**Access Roles:**
- viewer: Read-only access
- editor: Read and write access

request.description:
Use this API to add Users to:
1. **Organization:** This will provide them access to all the documents in the organization unless the document has `restricted` access type. It will also show users in the contact list of the organization.
2. **Folder:** This will provide them access to all the documents in the folder. If you pass the `folderId`, then the users will be added to the folder and not the organization.
3. **Document:** This will provide them access to the specified document. It will also show users in the contact list of the document. If you pass the `documentId`, then the users will be added to the document and not the organization or folder.

**Key Points:**
- Set `accessRole` to `viewer` (read-only) or `editor` (read/write) to define user's capabilities
- If organization does not exist, it will be created
- User's `initial` will be automatically created from the name field if not provided

üìö Full Documentation: https://docs.velt.dev/api-reference/rest-apis/v2/users/add-users

Generated from cURL: curl --location --request POST 'https://api.velt.dev/v2/users/delete' --header 'x-velt-api-key: <your-api-key>' --header 'x-velt-auth-token: <your-auth-token>' --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-raw '{"data":{"organizationId":"yourOrganizationId","userIds":["yourUserId1"]}}'

item.name: User Groups
item.description:
User Groups allow you to organize users into teams and manage permissions collectively.

**Available Operations:**
- Add User Groups: Create new groups
- Add Users to Groups: Add users to existing groups
- Delete Users from Groups: Remove users from groups

request.description: Generated from cURL: curl --location --request POST 'https://api.velt.dev/v2/organizations/usergroups/users/delete' --header 'x-velt-api-key: <your-api-key>' --header 'x-velt-auth-token: <your-auth-token>' --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-raw '{"data":{"organizationId":"yourOrganizationId","organizationUserGroupId":"yourGroupId","userIds":["yourUserId1"]}}'

item.name: Comments Feature
item.description:
Manage comments and comment annotations in your application. Comments can be attached to elements, text, or pages.

**Two Types:**
- Comment Annotations: The container that holds comments and metadata (location, status, priority, etc.)
- Comments: Individual messages within a comment annotation (thread)

item.name: Comment Annotations
item.description:
Comment Annotations are containers for comment threads. They include location data, status, priority, and other metadata.

**Available Operations:**
- Add: Create new comment annotations
- Get: Retrieve comment annotations
- Update: Modify annotation metadata (status, priority, assignee)
- Delete: Remove comment annotations
- Get Count: Get comment counts by status

item.name: Comments
item.description:
Individual comments within a comment annotation. Each comment represents a message in the thread.

**Available Operations:**
- Add: Add new comments to an annotation
- Get: Retrieve comments from an annotation
- Update: Edit comment content
- Delete: Remove comments

request.description: Generated from cURL: curl --location --request POST 'https://api.velt.dev/v2/commentannotations/comments/delete' --header 'x-velt-api-key: <your-api-key>' --header 'x-velt-auth-token: <your-auth-token>' --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-raw '{"data": {"organizationId": "yourOrganizationId","documentId": "yourDocumentId","annotationId": "yourAnnotationId","commentIds": [153783, 607395]}}'

item.name: Notifications
item.description:
Manage notifications sent to users through various channels (inbox, email, Slack).

**Available Operations:**
- Add: Send custom notifications
- Get: Retrieve notifications
- Update: Modify notification content
- Delete: Remove notifications
- Set Config: Configure notification channels
- Get Config: Retrieve notification settings

item.name: GDPR
item.description:
GDPR compliance endpoints for managing user data according to privacy regulations.

**Available Operations:**
- Get All User Data: Export all data for a specific user
- Delete All User Data: Permanently remove user data
- Get Delete Status: Check status of deletion jobs

item.name: Get Delete All User Data Status

request.description: Generated from cURL: curl --request POST 'https://api.velt.dev/v2/users/data/delete/status' --header 'x-velt-api-key: <your-api-key>' --header 'x-velt-auth-token: <your-auth-token>' --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-raw '{"data": {"jobId": "yourJobId"}}}'

item.name: Access Control
item.description:
Manage authentication tokens and user permissions for accessing Velt features.

**Available Operations:**
- Generate Token: Create JWT tokens for user authentication
- Add Permissions: Grant resource access to users
- Get Permissions: Retrieve user permissions
- Remove Permissions: Revoke user access

**Access Roles:**
- viewer: Read-only access
- editor: Read and write access

request.description: Generated from cURL: curl --request POST 'https://api.velt.dev/v2/auth/permissions/remove' --header 'x-velt-api-key: <your-api-key>' --header 'x-velt-auth-token: <your-auth-token>' --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-raw '{"data": {"userId": "USER_ID","permissions": {"resources": [{"type": "organization","id": "ORGANIZATION_ID"},{"type": "document","id": "DOCUMENT_ID","organizationId": "ORGANIZATION_ID"}]}}}'

item.name: Live State
item.description:
Broadcast real-time state changes and events to all connected users in a document.

**Use Cases:**
- Sync application state across users
- Broadcast custom events
- Share real-time data updates

**Available Operations:**
- Broadcast Event: Send real-time events to all users in a document

item.name: Workspace
item.description:
Manage workspace-level settings including domain whitelisting for security.

**Available Operations:**
- Add Domains: Whitelist domains for your workspace
- Delete Domains: Remove domains from whitelist

**Domain Whitelisting:**
Control which domains can access your Velt workspace. Supports wildcard patterns (e.g., `https://*.example.com`)

request.description: Generated from cURL: curl --request POST 'https://api.velt.dev/v2/workspace/domains/add' --header 'x-velt-api-key: <your-api-key>' --header 'x-velt-auth-token: <your-auth-token>' --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-raw '{"data": {"domains": ["https://www.google.com", "https://*.firebase.com"]}}'

Generated from cURL: curl --request POST 'https://api.velt.dev/v2/workspace/domains/delete' --header 'x-velt-api-key: <your-api-key>' --header 'x-velt-auth-token: <your-auth-token>' --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --data-raw '{"data": {"domains": ["https://www.google.com", "https://*.firebase.com"]}}'

exec: pm.test("Response has result or error object", function () {
pm.test("Response time is less than 5000ms", function () {
